parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A question, subject of inquiry, dispute. From zeteo; a search, i.e. a debate.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Religion in general; in a bad sense: superstition. From the same as deisidaimonesteros; religion.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To die, be dying, be dead. A strengthened form of a simpler primary thano than'-o; to die.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To assert, affirm, profess. Prolongation from the same as phemi; to assert.
To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
